column2: WEST VIRGINIA DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When they see this sign, drivers:
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column10: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 2. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column8: Round

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 4. Which shape is a yield sign?
column8: Upside-down triangle

column2: 5. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column8: red, green and yellow

column2: 6. When driving through a curve, you should:
column4: speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.
column8: stay near the right of your lane.
column10: slow as you enter, speed up as you exit.

column2: 7. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.

column2: 8. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column6: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column8: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 9. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 10. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______,Â sound your horn and brake.
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: stay in the center of your lane
column8: steer right

column2: 11. Streets and highways are most slippery:
column4: on the day before it starts to rain.
column6: just after it starts to rain.
column8: when it's been raining for one hour or more.

column2: 12. A steady green light at intersections means:
column6: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column8: You may not turn right
column10: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 13. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 14. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 15. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 16. If another driver does not dim his or her lights, you should:
column4: watch the oncoming vehicle out of the corner of your eye.
column8: look toward the left edge of your lane.
column10: look directly into the oncoming headlights.

column2: 17. This is:
column8: a right curve sign.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turns
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 20. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column8: furious driving

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column8: Four-lane highway ahead

column2: 22. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 23. When entering an interstate highway, you should:
column4: drive on the shoulder until you can enter traffic safely.
column6: check for cars, speed up to match the flow of traffic, and merge when safe to do so.
column8: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.
column10: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column8: Two one-way roads merge ahead

column2: 25. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column8: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column10: there is a school zone after the curve.
